metadata.Title: CVE-2015-5475 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in Request Tracker (RT) 4.x before 4.2.12 allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via vectors related to the (1) user and (2) group rights management pages.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-5475` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

request-tracker4 - 4.2.11-2
rt4-apache2 - 4.2.11-2
rt4-clients - 4.2.11-2
rt4-db-mysql - 4.2.11-2
rt4-db-postgresql - 4.2.11-2
rt4-db-sqlite - 4.2.11-2
rt4-fcgi - 4.2.11-2
rt4-standalone - 4.2.11-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: request-tracker4 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.11-2').
